title: Ivorian youth are swept up in a retro craze
subhed: Music and fashion from the 1960s and 1970s, once symbols of Côte d'Ivoire's post-independence economic and cultural boom, are experiencing an unexpected resurgence in popularity.

title: Spain, Ireland and the Netherlands pull out of 2026 Eurovision over Israel's participation
subhed: The organizers of next year's Eurovision Song Contest announced they were allowing Israel to compete on Thursday, drawing quick announcements of withdrawals from European countries critical of the Israeli offensive in Gaza.

title: Iran's independent cinema in full revolt: 'With Woman, Life, Freedom, a major barrier was broken'
subhed: Galvanized by the movement that emerged after the death of Mahsa Amini in September 2022, more and more filmmakers are dating to shoot outside any official framework. In a country where film production is a state matter, their films, made and distributed clandestinely, show Iranian society as it really is.

title: Zelensky without Yermak: The story of a split at the top of Ukraine
byline: By Ariane Chemin (Kyiv (Ukraine), special correspondent) and Thomas d’Istria (Kyiv (Ukraine), correspondent)
subhed: As Ukraine negotiates an end to the war, Volodymyr Zelensky had to part ways with his chief diplomat, Andriy Yermak, a political lightning rod and a close friend. The Ukrainian president is doing everything to downplay the departure of his right-hand man.

title: Influential study on glyphosate safety retracted 25 years after publication
subhed: A 2000 study that concluded the well-known herbicide glyphosate was safe, widely cited since then, has just been officially disavowed by the journal that published it. The scientists are suspected of having signed a text actually prepared by Monsanto.
